intro: Jacquemontia pringlei var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth jacquemontia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
